meanings.definition: To make known or state clearly
meanings.sent1: I will declare my love for you in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will declare the winner of the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: I declare that today is officially 'Pajama Day' at work!
meanings.sent4: The colorful flowers in the garden declare the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: She stood on the rooftop to declare her message to the whole town.

meanings.sent1: The mayor will declare the new park open to the public.
meanings.sent2: The president will declare a national holiday next week.
meanings.sent3: I declare today 'Ice Cream for Breakfast Day'!
meanings.sent4: The ringing of the bell will declare the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The judge will declare the verdict in the courtroom tomorrow.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds declare an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The map will declare the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: I declare my secret recipe for the best chocolate cake!
meanings.sent4: The old ruins declare the grandeur of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes declare the emotion behind the painting.

meanings.sent1: I declare that I will finish this project on time.
meanings.sent2: The witness will declare what he saw at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: I declare that I am the best dancer in the room!
meanings.sent4: Her confident tone declares her belief in her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The captain will declare his loyalty to his crew in times of trouble.

meanings.definition: To make a formal or explicit statement
meanings.sent1: The company will declare its earnings for the quarter.
meanings.sent2: The government will declare a state of emergency in the region.
meanings.sent3: I declare that today is 'Bring Your Pet to Work Day'!
meanings.sent4: His actions declare his commitment to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The treaty will declare the terms of peace between the two nations.
